column4: Q: I have a Creative Labs card; under Preferences/Sound I can click Test and get a beep, but can't play an mp3. Can someone help???
This isnt restricted to mp3s. The audio file 'plays' but i cant HEAR anything.
please try to install the codecs... if that still doesn't work, come back.
Many people here have been using Linux for longer than Ubuntu has even existed, we know what we're talking about  ;)
Just try to play something again...
lspci | grep -i audio ?
http://www.alsa-project.org/main/index.php/Matrix:Vendor-Creative_Labs
- results are in ---->
ahh... which do you want to use?
how is that relevant?
its information pertinent to my install
You never answered my question, which do you want to use?
i wish to employ the audio services of the Ensoniq branded sound card.
ok... 'lsmod | grep snd' <-- throw that output on paste.ubuntu.com
http://paste.ubuntu.com/29221/
ok... echo 'blacklist snd-ens1371' | sudo tee -a /etc/modprobe.d/blacklist ... then restart
K.
ok, so now my Ensoniq card, the one i wanted to use, isnt listed.
no Test beep, nothing.
doh... I'm dumb... nano /etc/modprobe.d/blacklist ... go to the very bottom, change snd-enswhatever to snd-intel8x0 and reboot... I'm helping a lot of people, got confused
Hey the audio works - thanks so much! So what we did was to blacklist the 'other' card?
Yes... your system was getting confused because 2 cards wanted the same device.
ah gotcha. Well, Thanks again :)
So we just told the system to ignore the onboard (I'm guessing?)
